title: Calories in Gyro Meat
meta_description: Discover calories in gyro meat per 100g, including protein, fat, carbs, and full nutrition breakdown with tweaks and FAQs for better meal planning.
assumptions: Lamb and beef mixture, cooked on vertical rotisserie, thinly sliced; no pita, veggies, or sauces included.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by meat blend, seasoning, cooking method, and brand. Check labels or restaurant info when available.

quick_answer.text: Gyro meat provides about 250 kcal per 100g, with high protein and fat content.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged or restaurant items.

tweaks.label: Use lean chicken gyro meat instead

faqs.q: How many calories in 100g of gyro meat?
faqs.a: Approximately 250 kcal per 100g of traditional lamb-beef gyro meat.

faqs.q: What is the protein content in gyro meat?
faqs.a: About 15g of protein per 100g, making it a good source for muscle building.

faqs.q: Is gyro meat high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, around 20g total fat per 100g, including 8g saturated fat.
Very low, only about 2g carbs per 100g, mostly from seasonings.

faqs.q: Why is sodium high in gyro meat?
faqs.a: Due to marinades and spices; around 700mg per 100g, so watch intake if on a low-sodium diet.
